Goblin_002.synopsis: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

Goblin_003.synopsis: Drunken goblin isn't scared of that famous hero the Blade of Frontiers!

Goblin_001.synopsis: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
Goblin_001.how_to_trigger: - loadlevel WLD_Main_A - goto 247.23; 40.947; 25.989- Talk to Warrior Plagg

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Goblin_001 is the only session with a clear trigger (speaking to Warrior Plagg) and sets up the reference to the hero, Blade of Frontiers. In its synopsis, it introduces this character in a belittling tone, which serves as context for subsequent ambient dialogues where other goblins comment on the hero. Goblin_002 and Goblin_003 both offer ambient remarks about Blade of Frontiers—one proclaiming that the hero is ineffective against the Absolute and the other coming from a drunken goblin who isn’t afraid of the famed hero. This suggests that encountering Goblin_001 first informs later ambient remarks. Additionally, given that they provide two distinct takes on the hero (one sober announcement and one drunken irreverence), they appear to represent alternative versions of ambient commentary and would not be encountered simultaneously during one playthrough. Thus, Goblin_002 and Goblin_003 should be treated as mutually exclusive.
